bKEWAx-s2.memHandModelNotes: Hunter (1990) & Robbins et al. (1989) suggested that 17 ha was the minimun area for breeding because probability of occurance halved with tracts less than 17 ha.  Whereas, BNA 324 indicate that fragments of at least 500 ha are needed for successful breeding and NatureServe (2005) recommend variability among fragment sizes from 30-500 ha). Amy Silvano 21apr05  NC-GAP used an avoid mask but I could not find conclusive documentation of these warblers avoiding urban areas. Hamel has an elevation limit of 3500 ft (breeds "sparingly up to 3500 ft"), and Simpson (1992) to 3800 ft in the Blue Ridge Amy Silvano 21apr05

bKEWAx-s6.memHandModelNotes: Hunter (1990) & Robbins et al. (1989) suggested that 17 ha was the minimun area for breeding because probability of occurance halved with tracts less than 17 ha.  Whereas, BNA 324 indicate that fragments of at least 500 ha are needed for successful breeding and NatureServe (2005) recommend variability among fragment sizes from 30-500 ha). Amy Silvano 21apr05  NC-GAP used an avoid mask but I could not find conclusive documentation of these warblers avoiding urban areas. Hamel has an elevation limit of 3500 ft (breeds "sparingly up to 3500 ft"), and Simpson (1992) to 3800 ft in the Blue Ridge Amy Silvano 21apr05
